column4: I get this error when I am trying to install compiz: ompiz-gnome: Depends: compizconfig-backend-gconf (>= 0.7.4) but it is not going to be installed
E: Broken packages
any idea how I can fix this? I have been dealing with this for a long time, please help
please someone help me with broken packages
Do you have any output from this?  sudo grep ppa /etc/apt/sources.list
I get this output: # deb http://ppa.launchpad.net/jason-scheunemann/ppa/ubuntu jaunty main # disabled on upgrade to jaunty
So its an upgrade plus you still have some ppas enabled. I suggest a clean install as a sure fix
do I have to clean install ubuntu? there is no way other than that?
The other way is to fix your broken packages, which may be very simple or quite impossible depending on what all youve done to break it
Yea the first thing would be to comment out that ppa, then run apt-get update && apt-get upgrade
See if it succeeds and go from there
what do you actually mean by commenting out?
I tried to install sopcast and that caused the break
Lines that start with # are ignored by the system and are called comments
Look at the output of apt-cache policy compiz
Its probably that you have old packages lying around from the upgrade
this the output I get from apt-cache policy compiz http://paste.ubuntu.com/478916/
Which version of ubuntu are you currently running?
Now, you see the output of apt-cache? It says you have compiz from lucid repos
this is the output http://paste.ubuntu.com/478917/
You need to make sure you have no lucid repos enabled (grep lucid /etc/apt/sources.list) then run apt-get update and reinstall all compiz packages
you mean the installation that I was following was just an workaround, it is from softpedia
Comment out any repos in your sources.list that arent lucid, then do apt-get update and reinstall all compiz packages
